comments: Number of ways to use the elements of {1,..,n} once each to form a sequence of lists, each having length at least 2. - Bob Proctor, Apr 19 2005
links: INRIA Algorithms Project, Encyclopedia of Combinatorial Structures 493
Robert A. Proctor, Let's Expand Rota's Twelvefold Way For Counting Partitions!, arXiv:math/0606404 [math.CO], 2006-2007.
Index entries for related partition-counting sequences
formula: a(1)=0, a(0)=1, (-2-n^2-3*n)*a(n) + (-2-n)*a(n+1) + a(n+2) = 0.Sum(1/5*(-1+3*_alpha)*_alpha^(-1-n), _alpha=RootOf(-1+_Z+_Z^2))*n!.a(n) = n!*Fibonacci(n-1) for n >= 1. - Bob Proctor, Apr 19 2005
author: encyclopedia(AT)pommard.inria.fr, Jan 25 2000
